summary: Wearing a mask is regarded as key to stopping the spread of Coronavirus. The majority call on people to wear a mask to stop the spread of the Coronavirus. A minority do not believe wearing a mask is essential because they believe the virus is a hoax. A minority believe President Trump is irresponsible about mask wearing. A minority believe the CDC is confusing the message about mask wearing.

summary: There is speculation about whether China is responsible for the Coronavirus pandemic. Most users say China closed down Wuhan and all domestic flights but allowed international travel to continue. It should have been more open and cooperative with other states at the beginning of the crisis. A minority think before China does more damage we should bomb the laboratories in Wuhan. A minority say it makes sense they didn't ban international flights while the virus was confined to Wuhan. A minority believe China deliberately spread the virus and now it's being used in the US to unseat president Trump.

Users believe we need specific strategies for different communities. A minority have no faith in the CDC's handling of the pandemic. All we can do is slow the spread and wait for the vaccine. A few users believe it's not the CDC's fault. A few users complain states are reopening as cases are going up. Too late. We should have been more cautious.

summary: Stay home advice splits opinion about personal safety versus economic prosperity. The majority believe people should stay at home to stop the Coronavirus from spreading. A minority believe people should not stay at home and should go back to work. A minority believe people are lazy for staying at home. A minority believe people will inevitably stay at home if you give them money to do so. A minority believe their political opponents should stay home and not vote.
